text: a traditional feel of pie is a lot of
work you have to butter each layer of
phyllo then you fill it and then when
you bake it you get something that's a
little bit on the flat side if you bake
your phyllo pie in a bundt pan it's half
the amount of work and it's very
beautiful the filling is fairly flexible
after you have your ricotta and your
eggs for structure you can add whatever
flavorings you like so I have some
parmesan we're cut a salata some black
pepper I'm just gonna mix it all up it's
really important to use good ricotta
here you know you the creamy kind the
kind of so good you just want to eat it
with a spoon and please do not use the
part-skim whenever you're working with
phyllo dough you want to keep it covered
with a damp cloth because otherwise
it'll dry out you don't have to press it
all the way in it's okay if there's a
little air there actually that adds
crunch makes it really nice and flaky
what I'm doing is I'm going kind of in a
crisscross pattern so I'll do one layer
like this and then the next layer like
this and that way all of the pan gets
covered after I added half of the
filling I'm gonna put in the prosciutto
in the mozzarella I like to have a
little bit of prosciutto to the ricotta
filling because I love that sort of
hammy meatiness but if you want this to
be a vegetarian dish and it's a great
vegetarian entree just leave it out and
then now you just want to fold the top
over
before you pour the butter in you want
to poke holes through the filling into
the phyllo crust and then you pour the
butter in and the butter can seep
through to the bottom and this is
important because you want the
butteriness to be just infused
throughout the entire torte and when it
bakes up it is golden it is shining it
is stunning and now for the unmolding
you want it cool enough so that you can
put your hands on it but warm it up so
that the butter is still kind of you
know squishy
that's the sound that's the sound we
want to hear I mean come on
another great thing about this torte is
that you can assemble the entire thing
the day before you want to serve it and
that way you can serve it warm and you
don't have to get up early and make it
that morning
you
